Some people don't deal with it, the power of it. Some do. Some feel the weight of it and it informs their choices. I've had to open up to grief in different contexts.
author: Tori Amos

quote: It was a time when only the dead smiled, happy in their peace.
author: Anna Akhmatova

quote: The government is tottering. We must deal it the death blow an any cost. To delay action is the same as death.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: If I ever completely lost my nervousness I would be frightened half to death.
author: Paul Lynde

quote: Most single moms are very poor, uneducated, can't get a job, and if it weren't for government assistance, their kids would be starving to death and never have health care. And that's the story that we're not seeing, and it's unfortunate that we glorify and glamorize the idea of out of children wedlock.
author: Mike Huckabee

quote: Death is the prerequisite to resurrection, the new life God intends.
author: John Ortberg

quote: I wish to be a martyr, and I don't fear death.
author: Muqtada al Sadr

quote: Death is a distant rumor to the young.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: Life is fragile: it thrives only in a narrow range of temperatures between freezing and boiling. How lucky that our planet is just the right distance from the sun: a little farther, and the death of the perpetual Antarctic winter - or worse - would prevail; a little closer, and the surface would truly fry anything that touched it.
author: Leonard Susskind

quote: If you believe in God, believe in Death Row East.
author: Tupac Shakur

quote: No true believer could be intolerant or a persecutor. If I were a magistrate and the law carried the death penalty against atheists, I would begin by sending to the stake whoever denounced another.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: I hit rock bottom, but thank God my bottom wasn't death.
author: Stevie Ray Vaughan

quote: The closer we come to the negative, to death, the more we blossom.
author: Montgomery Clift

quote: Wild animals never kill for sport. Man is the only one to whom the torture and death of his fellow creatures is amusing in itself.
author: James Anthony Froude

quote: The destination is a happy life, an accomplished life that doesn't end with death but with eternal life.
author: Angelo Scola

quote: The common bees will never use their sting upon the queen; if she is to be disposed of, they starve her to death, and the queen herself will sting nothing but royalty, nothing but a rival queen.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Because I could not stop for death, He kindly stopped for me; The carriage held but just ourselves and immortality.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: A man must be willing to die for justice. Death is an inescapable reality and men die daily, but good deeds live forever.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: For centuries the death penalty, often accompanied by barbarous refinements, has been trying to hold crime in check; yet crime persists. Why? Because the instincts that are warring in man are not, as the law claims, constant forces in a state of equilibrium.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Personally, I would be delighted if there were a life after death, especially if it permitted me to continue to learn about this world and others, if it gave me a chance to discover how history turns out.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Yes, I support the death penalty. It is an issue that cannot be fudged or hedged.
author: Dianne Feinstein

quote: Death and genitals are things that frighten people, and when people are frightened, they develop means of concealment and aggression. It is common sense.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: Seeing that our thirst was increasing and the water was killing us, while the storm did not abate, we agreed to trust to God, Our Lord, and rather risk the perils of the sea than wait there for certain death from thirst.
author: Alvar N. C. de Vaca

quote: I have no fear of death. More important, I don't fear life.
author: Steven Seagal

quote: You can't reconcile being pro-life on abortion and pro-death on the death penalty.
author: N. T. Wright

quote: The two great risks are risking too much but also risking too little. That's for each person to decide. For me, not risking anything is worse than death. By far.
author: Jimmy Chin

quote: Watching a peaceful death of a human being reminds us of a falling star one of a million lights in a vast sky that flares up for a brief moment only to disappear into the endless night forever.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: If you think aficionados of a living Constitution want to bring you flexibility, think again. You think the death penalty is a good idea? Persuade your fellow citizens to adopt it. You want a right to abortion? Persuade your fellow citizens and enact it. That's flexibility.
author: Antonin Scalia

quote: There should be weeping at a man's birth, not at his death.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: Marriage is almost as old as dirt, and it was defined in the garden between Adam and Eve. One man, one woman for life till death do you part. So I would never attempt to try to redefine marriage. And I don't think anyone else should either. So do I support the idea of gay marriage? No, I don't.
author: Kirk Cameron

quote: If my survival caused another to perish, then death would be sweeter and more beloved.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: Some people hate funerals. I find them comforting. They hit the pause button on life and remind us that it has an end. Every eulogy reminds me to deepen my dash, that place on the tombstone between our birth and our death.
author: Regina Brett

quote: 'Death at an Early Age' was about racial segregation in Boston. 'Illiterate America' was about grownups who can't read. 'Rachel and Her Children' was about people who were homeless in the middle of Manhattan.
author: Jonathan Kozol

quote: Death can never kill an idea. Ideas are more powerful than death. Ideas outlive men and can never be destroyed.
author: Myles Munroe

quote: If I die a violent death, as some fear and a few are plotting, I know that the violence will be in the thought and the action of the assassins, not in my dying.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: My character and good name are in my own keeping. Life with disgrace is dreadful. A glorious death is to be envied.
author: Horatio Nelson

quote: In an artwork you're always looking for artistic decisions, so an ashtray is perfect. An ashtray has got life and death.
author: Damien Hirst

quote: I couldn't have foreseen all the good things that have followed my mother's death. The renewed energy, the surprising sweetness of grief. The tenderness I feel for strangers on walkers. The deeper love I have for my siblings and friends. The desire to play the mandolin. The gift of a visitation.
author: Mary Schmich

quote: Religion provides the only story that is fundamentally consoling in the face of the worst possible experiences - the death of a parent, for instance. In fact, many religions take away the problem entirely, because their adherents ostensibly believe that they're going to be reunited with everyone they love, and death is an illusion.
author: Sam Harris

quote: Puerto Ricans who find they can no longer afford to keep their pets often choose to drop their dogs, sometimes even whole litters of puppies, at a beach - sometimes under cover of night, in secret - rather than surrender the animal to a city or state-run shelter where the animals will face grim conditions and almost certain death by euthanasia.
author: Juliana Hatfield

quote: Everything about aging in my experience so far has been a plus. Except the death part!
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: The sinner who suddenly realizes God's love for him and then looks at his rejection of that love feels a loss similar to the death of a loved one. A deep void is created in the soul and a loneliness akin to the agony of death.
author: Mother Angelica

quote: Death is caused by swallowing small amounts of saliva over a long period of time.
author: George Carlin

quote: With actors, all our ages are out there for all to see - you can't hide anything, really. And it's kind of a relief. This is my age, this is what I look like without makeup on - who cares? That youth culture - that lying about your age - it's all denial of death anyway.
author: Julianne Moore

quote: I've said this over and over, but I'll say it a million more times - I'm concerned more about the death of a bee than I am about terrorism. Because we're losing hives and bees by the millions because of such strong pesticides.
author: Patti Smith

quote: I will admit, like Socrates and Aristotle and Plato and some other philosophers, that there are instances where the death penalty would seem appropriate.
author: Jack Kevorkian

quote: I won't forget the hood. I won't forget the days of catching a bullet on the way to the mailbox or bricks with death threats that somehow made their way through the window.
author: Pau Gasol

quote: There exists in some parts of the world sanctimonious criticism of America's death penalty, as somehow unworthy of a civilized society.
author: Antonin Scalia

quote: At a formal dinner party, the person nearest death should always be seated closest to the bathroom.
author: George Carlin

quote: The idea is to die young as late as possible.
author: Ashley Montagu

quote: Man always dies before he is fully born.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Fear of death makes us devoid both of valour and religion. For want of valour is want of religious faith.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Liberty for wolves is death to the lambs.
author: Isaiah Berlin

quote: It is neccessary to have wished for death in order to know how good it is to live.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: The appeal of cinema lies in the fear of death.
author: Jim Morrison

quote: Death is delightful. Death is dawn, The waking from a weary night Of fevers unto truth and light.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Life itself is but the shadow of death, and souls departed but the shadows of the living.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: There are certain people that are marked for death. I have my little list of those that treated me unfairly.
author: Jennifer Lopez

quote: Emigration is no longer a solution; it's a defeat. People are risking death, drowning every day, but they're knocking on doors that are not open.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

quote: As the fly bangs against the window attempting freedom while the door stands open, so we bang against death ignoring heaven.
author: Douglas Horton

quote: And I will show that nothing can happen more beautiful than death.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I've always been slightly preoccupied with death or whatever those kind of silly big questions people will tell you to not spend your time worrying about.
author: Conor Oberst

quote: When I first met Alan Parker, who directed 'Angel Heart,' he'd heard so many horror stories about me that he was literally scared to death of me. Right away, he sat me down and said, 'I'm very scared of you. I've heard you're a very bad boy.'
author: Mickey Rourke

quote: Pain is the mind. It's the thoughts of the mind. Then I get rid of the thoughts, and I get in my witness, which is down in my spiritual heart. The witness that witnesses being. Then those particular thoughts that are painful - love them. I love them to death!
author: Ram Dass

quote: People think that by living on some mountainside in a tent and being frozen to death by freezing rain, they're somehow discovering reality, but of course that's just another fiction dreamed up by a TV producer.
author: J. G. Ballard

quote: The silver swan, who, living had no note, When death approached unlocked her silent throat.
author: Orlando Gibbons

quote: Who is there that can adequately gauge the greatness of the humility, gentleness, self-surrender, revealed by the Lord of majesty in assuming human nature, in accepting the punishment of death, the shame of the cross?
author: Saint Bernard

quote: I joyfully hasten to meet death. If it come before I have had opportunity to develop all my artistic faculties, it will come, my hard fate notwithstanding, too soon, and I should probably wish it later - yet even then I shall be happy, for will it not deliver me from a state of endless suffering?
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quote: In India we only read about death, sickness, terrorism, crime.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Man and animals are in reality vehicles and conduits of food, tombs of animals, hostels of Death, coverings that consume, deriving life by the death of others.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: It's not morbid to talk about death. Most people don't worry about death, they worry about a bad death.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: God, who preferred the correction rather than the death of a sinner, did not desire that a homicide be punished by the exaction of another act of homicide.
author: Saint Ambrose

quote: No matter what is happening in life or in the world - war, natural disaster, poor health, pain, the death of loved ones - if existence is filled with art, music and literature, life will be fulfilling, a joy.
author: Karen DeCrow

quote: In classical times, it was a capital offense to speculate upon the hour of a king's death or upon the identity of his successor.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: Many people assume the diseases that kill us are pre-programmed into our genes. High blood pressure by 55, heart attacks at 60, maybe cancer at 70, and so on... But for most of the leading causes of death, our genes usually account for only 10-20 per cent of risk.
author: Michael Greger

quote: Old age is a tyrant, who forbids, under pain of death, the pleasures of youth.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Some of us can be examples about going ahead and growing, and some of us, unfortunately, don't make it there, and end up being examples because they had to die. I hit rock bottom, but thank God my bottom wasn't death.
author: Stevie Ray Vaughan

quote: Faithfulness to the past can be a kind of death above ground. Writing of the past is a resurrection the past then lives in your words and you are free.
author: Jessamyn West

quote: I mean, death is a serious thing, certainly not to be sneezed at.
author: Morrissey

quote: I want to see the U.S. wiped out. Death to the U.S.
author: Bobby Fischer

quote: My old man taught me a lot of stuff in his death that I don't even know if he would have been able to teach me had he been alive. And that was to never do stuff that can jeopardize the people you love and hurt them.
author: Freddie Prinze, Jr.

quote: Following Michael Brown's death, I went to Ferguson and met with his parents. I stood with them as they tried to hold their heads high and deal with both their immense loss and the larger issues of police-community relations.
author: Al Sharpton

quote: The first memory I have in the world is of death and tears. That is how I would mark the beginning of my life: the way people mark the end of one. My family had gathered at Papa Joe's house because Mam' Grace was slipping away, only I didn't register it that way. For some reason I thought that it was her birthday.
author: Charles M. Blow

quote: Does not the very word 'creative' mean to build, to initiate, to give out, to act - rather than to be acted upon, to be subjective? Living photography is positive in its approach, it sings a song of life - not death.
author: Berenice Abbott

quote: Life is doubt, and faith without doubt is nothing but death.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: Beauty is a precious trace that eternity causes to appear to us and that it takes away from us. A manifestation of eternity, and a sign of death as well.
author: Eugene Ionesco

quote: Death never takes the wise man by surprise, he is always ready to go.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: For those who live neither with religious consolations about death nor with a sense of death (or of anything else) as natural, death is the obscene mystery, the ultimate affront, the thing that cannot be controlled. It can only be denied.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: The charm of fame is so great that we like every object to which it is attached, even death.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: A belief in hell and the knowledge that every ambition is doomed to frustration at the hands of a skeleton have never prevented the majority of human beings from behaving as though death were no more than an unfounded rumor.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Our law is a Jordanian law that we inherited, which applies to both the West Bank and Gaza, and sets the death penalty for those who sell land to Israelis.
author: Yasser Arafat

quote: Fads are the kiss of death. When the fad goes away, you go with it.
author: Conway Twitty

quote: Rock and menopause do not mix. It is not good, it sucks and every day I fight it to the death, or, at the very least, not let it take me over.
author: Stevie Nicks

quote: I am not the born how can there be either birth or death for me?
author: Guru Nanak

quote: Agitate! Agitate! Ought to be the motto of every reformer. Agitation is the opposite of stagnation - the one is life, the other death.
author: Ernestine Rose

quote: Saddam's fate should be in the hands of his country men. They were the major victims of his brutal reign and should decide his life, death, or permanent imprisonment. Personally, I would lock him away forever.
author: Ronnie James Dio

quote: We were then in a dangerous, helpless situation, exposed daily to perils and death amongst savages and wild beasts, not a white man in the country but ourselves.
author: Daniel Boone

quote: To live without risk for me would be tantamount to death.
author: Jacqueline Cochran

quote: Had it not been for slavery, the death penalty would have likely been abolished in America. Slavery became a haven for the death penalty.
author: Angela Davis

quote: I am reconciled to my death, but I detest the mode.
author: John Andre

quote: Sleep is lovely, death is better still, not to have been born is of course the miracle.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: I think that we should be eternally vigilant against attempts to check the expression of opinions that we loathe and believe to be fraught with death, unless they so imminently threaten immediate interference with the lawful and pressing purposes of the law that an immediate check is required to save the country.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: The death penalty is being applied in the United States as a fatal lottery.
author: Bianca Jagger

quote: To be immortal is commonplace; except for man, all creatures are immortal, for they are ignorant of death; what is divine, terrible, incomprehensible, is to know that one is immortal.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: There's nothing wrong in suffering, if you suffer for a purpose. Our revolution didn't abolish danger or death. It simply made danger and death worthwhile.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: I have two luxuries to brood over in my walks, your loveliness and the hour of my death. O that I could have possession of them both in the same minute.
author: John Keats

quote: For children preserve the fame of a man after his death.
author: Aeschylus

quote: The writer crafts their ideal world. In my world, everyone has really long conversations or just picks apart pop culture to death and everyone talks in monologue.
author: Kevin Smith

quote: In Seattle, I soon found that my radical ideas and aesthetic explorations - ideas and explorations that in Richmond, Virginia, might have gotten me stoned to death with hush puppies - were not only accepted but occasionally applauded.
author: Tom Robbins

quote: Of course, we avoid death. To know something is inevitable is one thing. To accept, to truly feel it... that's different.
author: Michael Haneke

quote: Libertarians know that a free country has nothing to fear from anyone coming in or going out - while a welfare state is scared to death of poor people coming in and rich people getting out.
author: Harry Browne

quote: India made a big mistake by signing up to TRIPS. With a population of 1.3 billion, India can't afford a monopoly in healthcare. Monopolies lead to higher prices and we can't allow them in a country like India with so much poverty and misery. It was like signing our own death warrant.
author: Yusuf Hamied

quote: If you look at the beginning of this country, when the pilgrims came to this country, the first year they had a communistic experiment. They said, 'OK, we're going to take the land, we're going to work the land together and share in the fruits of our labor.' They almost starved to death. Almost half of them died that first year.
author: Rafael Cruz

quote: A filmmaker doesn't have to suffer to show suffering. You just have to understand it. You don't have to die to shoot a death scene.
author: David Lynch

quote: Nixon was a bad loser. He hated losing worse than death, and that is why I enjoyed him. We were both football fans, both addicts; and on some days, nothing else mattered.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: Even though everybody's lives are different, in general we're all human beings, and we go through the same things: disappointments, the pleasures of life, life and death. That's always been a really big part of the show to me, making sure the audience feels connected, and that carries through to the album.
author: Joan Jett

quote: I am profoundly fascinated by cruelty, fear, horror and death. My films show my preoccupation with violence, the pathology of violence.
author: Fritz Lang

quote: The obvious objections to the execution of Saddam Hussein are valid and well aired. His death will provoke violent strife between Sunni and Shia Muslims, and between Iraqis in general and the American occupation forces.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: I feel about aging the way William Saroyan said he felt about death: Everybody has to do it, but I always believed an exception would be made in my case.
author: Martha Beck

quote: For me, since I have a life wish, not a death wish, for me, I was not gambling my life. I was doing something much more beautiful. I was carrying my life across.
author: Philippe Petit

quote: I think if 'The Narrow Road To The Deep North' is one of the high points of Japanese culture, then the experience of my father, who was a slave laborer on the Death Railway, represents one of its low points.
author: Richard Flanagan

quote: We hear tears loudly on this side of Heaven. What we don't take time to contemplate are the even louder cheers on the other side of death's valley.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: The amount of death terror experienced is closely related to the amount of life unlived.
author: Irvin D. Yalom

quote: Prior to penicillin and medical research, death was an everyday occurrence. It was intimate.
author: Katherine Dunn

quote: Statistics are the triumph of the quantitative method, and the quantitative method is the victory of sterility and death.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: Everything that gets born dies.
author: Morrie Schwartz

quote: You've never seen death? Look in the mirror every day and you will see it like bees working in a glass hive.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: In order to speak about all and to all, one has to speak of what all know and of the reality common to us all. The sea, rains, necessity, desire, the struggle against death... these are things that unite us all.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Once writing has become your major vice and greatest pleasure, only death can stop it.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: If someone were to say that life at hard labor is as painful as death and therefore equally cruel, I should reply that, taking all the unhappy moments of perpetual slavery together, it is perhaps even more painful, but these moments are spread out over a lifetime, and capital punishment exercises all its power in an instant.
author: Cesare Beccaria

quote: I'm not afraid to die.
author: John Wooden

quote: Death is the cure for all diseases.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: I detest life-insurance agents: they always argue that I shall some day die, which is not so.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: I had seen birth and death but had thought they were different.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Death is a very dull, dreary affair, and my advice to you is to have nothing whatsoever to do with it.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: The words of a dead man are modified in the guts of the living.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Some men are alive simply because it is against the law to kill them.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: Love and death are the two great hinges on which all human sympathies turn.
author: B. R. Hayden

quote: Birth and death we all move between these two unknowns.
author: Bryant H. McGill

quote: Dying is easy, it's living that scares me to death.
author: Annie Lennox

quote: Grumbling is the death of love.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: The gods conceal from men the happiness of death, that they may endure life.
author: Lucan

quote: A new idea is delicate. It can be killed by a sneer or a yawn it can be stabbed to death by a quip and worried to death by a frown on the right man's brow.
author: Ovid

quote: When you break up, your whole identity is shattered. It's like death.
author: Dennis Quaid

quote: On the plus side, death is one of the few things that can be done as easily lying down .
author: Woody Allen

quote: Success is like death. The more successful you become, the higher the houses in the hills get and the higher the fences get.
author: Kevin Spacey

quote: Pain and death are part of life. To reject them is to reject life itself.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: The greatest men of a nation are those it puts to death.
author: Ernest Renan

quote: Birth was the death of him.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Though it be in the power of the weakest arm to take away life, it is not in the strongest to deprive us of death.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: I'm not afraid of death. It's the stake one puts up in order to play the game of life.
author: Jean Giraudoux

quote: A useless life is an early death.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: The passion of hatred is so long lived and so obstinate a malady that the surest sign of death in a sick person is their desire for reconciliation.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Your body must become familiar with its death - in all its possible forms and degrees - as a self-evident, imminent, and emotionally neutral step on the way towards the goal you have found worthy of your life.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Death is the veil which those who live call life; They sleep, and it is lifted.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Men should be bewailed at their birth, and not at their death.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: We are all of us resigned to death: it's life we aren't resigned to.
author: Graham Greene

quote: I believe that fear of life brings a greater fear of death.
author: David Blaine

quote: When I listen to music, I don't want to hear about flowers. I like death and destruction.
author: Jonathan Davis

quote: I saw also that there was an ocean of darkness and death, but an infinite ocean of light and love, which flowed over the ocean of darkness.
author: George Fox

quote: The death penalty, I think, is a terrible scar on American justice, especially the concept of equal justice under law, but also of due process. And it goes state by state, and it's different in different states.
author: Burke Marshall

quote: Nothing is more dreadful in life than the profound thought that death may only greet you with eternal nothingness.
author: Kim Elizabeth

quote: Death is the only pure, beautiful conclusion of a great passion.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: I do not care so much for the death of my gunner, as for other passages of my voyage, for I have good friends in England that will bring me off for that.
author: William Kidd

quote: Death gives meaning to our lives. It gives importance and value to time. Time would become meaningless if there were too much of it.
author: Ray Kurzweil

quote: When the courts decide that murderers, rapists, and others who maliciously break our social contract deserve health care that most working Americans can't afford, they are condemning good people to death.
author: Tammy Bruce

quote: The coward sneaks to death the brave live on.
author: George Sewell

quote: I think about death a lot, like I think we all do. I don't think of suicide as an option, but as fun. It's an interesting idea that you can control how you go. It's this thing that's looming, and you can control it.
author: Ryan Gosling

quote: An insatiable appetite for glory leads to sacrifice and death, but innate instinct leads to self-preservation and life.
author: Jose Marti

quote: Many cats are the death of the mouse.
author: Kaspar Hauser

quote: Life comes to the miners out of their deaths, and death out of their lives.
author: Mary Harris Jones

quote: Death is a very important part of life.
author: GG Allin

quote: Nothing in life is certain except death, taxes and the second law of thermodynamics.
author: Seth Lloyd

quote: There is nothing glamorous about death.
author: Roger Moore

quote: Death remains about the one certain fact in the lives of each one of us, and there will be suffering, sorrow, and sadness next week as there was last week.
author: Basil Hume

quote: Today she is the lady of death, which I believe is the best muse to have.
author: Kit Williams

quote: All I want is a gentleman. I'm sick to bloody death of bastards.
author: Katie Price

quote: I came face to face with death at thirteen years old.
author: Ryan White

quote: The American people know that every day 3,000 kids begin to smoke, 1,000 of them die an early death. They're not going to allow us to go forward this year and not have comprehensive bipartisan legislation. It's in everybody's best interest.
author: Erskine Bowles

quote: Death is very often referred to as a good career move.
author: Buddy Holly

quote: Dying before dying has two important consequences: It liberates the individual from the fear of death and influences the actual experience of dying at the time of biological demise.
author: Stanislav Grof

quote: Oh eyes, no eyes, but fountains fraught with tears; O life, no life, but lively form of death; Oh world, no world, but mass of public wrongs.
author: Thomas Kyd

quote: The life of men and women is so cheap and property is so sacred. There are so many of us for one job it matters little if 146 of us are burned to death.
author: Rose Schneiderman

quote: What are you gonna do, talk the alien to death?
author: James Cameron

quote: I was blessed with a birth and a death, and I guess I just want some say in between.
author: Ani DiFranco

quote: You haven't lost anything when you know were it is. Death can hide but not divide.
author: Vance Havner

quote: Don't be afraid to feel as angry or as loving as you can, because when you feel nothing, it's just death.
author: Lena Horne

quote: Other states are trying to abolish the death penalty... mine's putting in an express lane.
author: Ron White

quote: I now bid farewell to the country of my birth - of my passions - of my death a country whose misfortunes have invoked my sympathies - whose factions I sought to quell - whose intelligence I prompted to a lofty aim - whose freedom has been my fatal dream.
author: Thomas Francis Meagher

quote: It is a sign of creeping inner death when we can no longer praise the living.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: When death has you by the throat, you don't mince words.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: To die for one's country is such a worthy fate that all compete for so beautiful a death.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: To some extent I liken slavery to death.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Well, there's a remedy for all things but death, which will be sure to lay us flat one time or other.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Not even old age knows how to love death.
author: Sophocles

quote: Each instant of life is a step toward death.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: The miser, starving his brother's body, starves also his own soul, and at death shall creep out of his great estate of injustice, poor and naked and miserable.
author: Theodore Parker

quote: The slave is doomed to worship time and fate and death, because they are greater than anything he finds in himself, and because all his thoughts are of things which they devour.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Let us eat and drink neither forgetting death unduly nor remembering it. The Lord hath mercy on whom he will have mercy, etc., and the less we think about it the better.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: All stories interest me, and some haunt me until I end up writing them. Certain themes keep coming up: justice, loyalty, violence, death, political and social issues, freedom.
author: Isabel Allende

quote: To be clear, climate change is a true 800 pound gorilla in the room. The effects of global warming threaten global environmental upheaval over the coming century. But for South Florida and the Everglades, it could be our death knell if urgent action is not taken.
author: Debbie Wasserman Schultz

quote: Patrick Henry did not say, 'Give me absolutely safety or give me death.' America is supposed to be about freedom.
author: John Stossel

quote: I'm not in favor of the death penalty. But I'm in favor of locking these people away in maximum security units where they can never get out. They can never escape. They can never be paroled. Lock the bad ones away. But you gotta rethink everybody else.
author: John Grisham

quote: My mother's death put me in touch with my most savage self. As I've grown up and come to terms with her death and accepted it, the pieces of her that I keep don't exist materially.
author: Cheryl Strayed

quote: It's not the normal way to look at things but I experienced death at a really young age and because of that it's been part of my mental landscape that death is really very possible.
author: Cate Blanchett

quote: Death is the ultimate enemy - and I find nothing reproachable in those who rage mightily against the dying of the light.
author: Stephen Jay Gould

quote: And I love Evander Holyfield to death!
author: Ray Lewis

quote: For me it was a lot harder to come to terms with the death of my grandfather than it was to come to terms with what's happened to the former Yugoslavia.
author: Tea Obreht

quote: There are some people who walk into a room and they oxygenate it, by their very being there's fresh air. Then there are those who come in with the smell of death and they suck the life out.
author: Peter Mullan

quote: I'm 64 years old and, yeah, I went through a transition in my life last year, with the death of my son, that woke me up to a lot of things. You know, I'm perfectly happy in my own little groove. Marching along, building my company, and you know, a happy person.
author: Carl Paladino

quote: The good news is that even though we walk through this valley of death, we don't have to fear, at least not for ourselves! Unfortunately, there is no way to skip over the valley altogether, we must face death and the evidence of evil all around us. But there will come a day... And what a day that will be!
author: Ted Dekker

quote: Death, the real simile for disease - for when we are ill, do we not always feel like we are dying, even if it's only a little? - remains, despite our secularism, the most metaphoricised phenomenon of all.
author: Will Self

quote: You may have gathered that I am not the most cheerful of revellers - some characterise me as the death and soullessness of any party but it wasn't always so, believe me.
author: Will Self

quote: Meditation on inevitable death should be performed daily. Every day one should meditate on being carried away by surging waves, falling from thousand-foot cliffs, dying of disease.
author: Yamamoto Tsunetomo

quote: At the end of our lives, we step across the threshold or death and enter into a new and better world. I believe that. It's just that simple.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: If you look in general at people who live in anarchy, they have quite high rates of death from either homicide or warfare or both. Anarchy is one of the main reasons for violence, and it may be the most important.
author: Steven Pinker

quote: What I'm after is not living to 1,000. I'm after letting people avoid death for as long as they want to.
author: Aubrey de Grey

quote: Am I a trance medium? No. Have I got a gift psychically? Absolutely not. But I believe in the survival of consciousness after death.
author: Dan Aykroyd

quote: My mother's death brought me to my knees. She was my hero, my role model, my very best friend. I spoke to her every single day of my life. I really tried hard when I grew up to make her proud of me.
author: Maria Shriver

quote: I think it's very dangerous, the idea of celebrity - you have to be constantly controversial to maintain the status of celebrity. Reality TV is the death of entertainment - it's just mindless TV but popular because of its voyeuristic nature, and people are very voyeuristic.
author: David Suchet

quote: Even if we mortgage the next 100 years of generations of human beings, we would not have enough energy to build a Death Star.
author: Michio Kaku

quote: Real heroes are those who face death for a principle - say, to save the lives of others - without any promise of reward.
author: Alan Dershowitz

quote: I'm interested in time, fame, death, beauty, truth, all those things.
author: Marianne Faithfull

quote: At the time of his death, John Kennedy had a national security establishment that was a writhing ball of snakes.
author: Charlie Pierce

quote: I am more interested in how people interpret the phrase 'Elect The Dead' than what I may or may not have intended. I named the album after the track, which is a spiritual song about love, life and death and is the heaviest song on the album without having any heavy instruments.
author: Serj Tankian

quote: When you have closed the Bible, you have neither closed God's mind nor shut God's mouth. God continues to speak, live and exist. I think we should consult the living God for the living word for living people dealing with death, destruction and despair in the midst of our hurt humanity. I believe love will conquer all.
author: Michael Eric Dyson

quote: Even a cup of coffee tastes so much sweeter because you've come once again out of the, literally, out of the edge of death, and that's the condition I suppose that a lot of artists and writers would like to be in.
author: Christopher Koch

quote: We are eternal beings. We lived as intelligent spirits before this mortal life. We are now living part of eternity. Our mortal birth was not the beginning; death, which faces all of us, is not the end.
author: Ezra Taft Benson

quote: My dad died when I was 23. His death was sudden and shocking - the result of a car crash - and I never got to say goodbye.
author: Dani Shapiro

quote: Banks will fee you to death. If you bounce a check, the bank has a policy to re-post the check three more times to see if it will be paid. If it continues to bounce they charge a $30 overdraft every time. So, one bounced check will rack up $90 for the bank.
author: Jonathan Raymond

quote: I believe in the freedom of choice in both life and death.
author: Dasha Zhukova

quote: If death weren't around to 'finalize' the Darwinian process, we'd all still be amoebas.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: If we heard that somebody starved to death in Sweden or Switzerland, we would be shocked.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: I blame feminism and Facebook for the death of the American automobile. I'm a Republican, so I blame everything on feminism - or commies.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: Of all the logical impasses, unknowings, paradoxes, and terrors that provoke laughter, death by its finality and unsolvable mystery is paramount.
author: Andrew Hudgins

quote: I was born on January 8, 1942, exactly three hundred years after the death of Galileo. I estimate, however, that about two hundred thousand other babies were also born that day. I don't know whether any of them was later interested in astronomy.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: I have my very own Oscar now to be with me until death us do part.
author: Peter O'Toole

quote: The Secret Revelation of John opens, again, in crisis. The disciple John, grieving Jesus' death, is walking toward the temple when he meets a Pharisee who mocks him for having been deceived by a false messiah. These taunts echoed John's own fear and doubt.
author: Elaine Pagels

quote: Cinema sustains life. It captures death in its progress.
author: Harmony Korine

quote: My death is incidental, and I worry very much about my loved ones and, you know, would like to make it as easy as possible for them. Or wish I could will away whatever, you know, the sadness they will feel when I die. But for me, nothing. The world goes on.
author: Barbara Ehrenreich

quote: I never had a conscious fear of death, but I did have a conscious fear of sickness. By the time I completed medical school, that fear was gone.
author: Sherwin B. Nuland

quote: Obviously, there's a part of me that takes the world of violence and death very seriously. However, when it comes to protection, or when it comes to just the skill of shooting... I've gone to the range with sniper rifles and things like that.
author: Angelina Jolie

quote: With plastic surgery, the general anesthetic is like a black-velvety sleep, and that's what death is - without waking up to someone clapping and going, 'Joan, wake up, it's all over and you're looking pretty'.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: 'Sesame Street's' genius lies in finding gentle ways to talk about hard things - death, divorce, danger - in terms that children understand and accept.
author: Nancy Gibbs

quote: The leading cause of death for girls 15 to 19 worldwide is not accident or violence or disease; it is complications from pregnancy. Girls under 15 are up to five times as likely to die while having children than are women in their 20s, and their babies are more likely to die as well.
author: Nancy Gibbs

quote: Drake's my little brother; I love him to death, and he's family-oriented.
author: Birdman

quote: When I first came into parliament, there was, on average, a by-election every three months - due not to MPs bailing out, but because of the death rate.
author: David Blunkett

quote: I'm a huge animal lover - I love animals to death. I've got tortoises and three dogs, and I've had a million animals in the past. I just think that we should do all we can to take care of them.
author: Roshon Fegan

quote: At the heart of Christian faith is the story of Jesus' death and resurrection.
author: John Ortberg

quote: We've enshrined the purity, sanctity, value, and importance of bringing children into the world, yet we don't discuss death. There used to be an enshrined period where mourning was a necessary part of going through the process of grieving; death wasn't considered morbid or antisocial. But that's totally gone.
author: Cate Blanchett

quote: I've done a lot of death cartoons - tombstones, Grim Reaper, illness, obituaries... I'm not great at analyzing things, but my guess is that maybe the only relief from the terror of being alive is jokes.
author: Roz Chast

quote: I love my wife to death. I mean my ex-wife.
author: Stewart Rahr

quote: No city owns me, you know what I'm saying? I'm from New York, but no city owns me. Nobody can bottle up my sound and box me in. Yes, I am a rapper, but am I a New York rapper? No. I am from New York, I love New York to death, but I will not conform myself to one place, no.
author: ASAP Ferg

quote: Good taste is death vulgarity is life.
author: Mary Quant

quote: If you're going to write about war, the ugly side is inevitable. Suffering and death are obviously part of war.
author: Phil Klay

quote: I say that no man can be greater than the man who bravely and heroically sacrifices his life for the good of others. No man can be greater than the one who meets death face to face, and yet will not shrink from what he believes to be his highest duty.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: If we ignore our death, we end up just going around completely oblivious to why we do the things we do!
author: Caitlin Doughty

quote: For thousands of years, we did have death surrounding us, and we did have people die in the home. You would take care of your own end. You would do ritual processes, and you would be involved in it, and that's been taken away in the Western world.
author: Caitlin Doughty

quote: Humans are insane. We kill our own people, starve our own people, sell them, work them to death, beat them, don't give them affordable/free/good healthcare, and let them live in misery, while a few of us have - we have all we want. We are evil.
author: Faith Hunter

quote: I have been connected with the Niels Bohr Institute since the completion of my university studies, first as a research fellow and, from 1956, as a professor of physics at the University of Copenhagen. After the death of my father in 1962, I followed him as director of the Institute until 1970.
author: Aage Bohr

quote: You're trying to write about something that's sacred. You're trying to bring the seriousness of life and death to it, and you're trying to find a way to dramatize it, and you're trying to give language to it, which is inadequate. But it's important to try.
author: Edward Hirsch

quote: In an area of more than 1,000 war graves and with birdsong as the only sound, I contemplated the thin margin between life and death. If the sniper's bullet had been just two feet to one side, my father's life would have been over, aged just 27, and I would never have been born.
author: Michael Ashcroft

quote: 'Hard Hit,' a YA collection of poems, explores the country of grief and survival. Mark, a 16-year-old boy and skilled pitcher, must confront the coming death of his beloved father with the help of his friends, family, baseball, and an idiosyncratic belief in God. I used my own experience of my parents' deaths to inform this journey.
author: Ann Turner

quote: The minute we stop learning, we begin death, the process of dying. We learn from each other with every action we perform. We are teaching goodness or evil every time we step out of the house and into the street.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Infectious diseases have become less prominent as causes of death and disability in regions of improved sanitation and adequate supplies of antibiotics.
author: Rosalyn Sussman Yalow

quote: After my death, the molecules of my being will return to the earth and the sky. They came from the stars. I am of the stars.
author: Charles Lindbergh

quote: I've stopped reading about the death of books because it's wasteful and morbid and insulting to the authors, agents, publishers, booksellers, critics, and readers that keep the world community of fiction interesting.
author: Patrick deWitt

quote: The typical Western diet is the number-one cause of premature death and the number-one cause of disability. In other words, a long and healthy life is largely a matter of choice.
author: Michael Greger

quote: Always read something that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: Know one knows whether death, which people fear to be the greatest evil, may not be the greatest good.
author: Plato

quote: An unused life is an early death.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Death most resembles a prophet who is without honor in his own land or a poet who is a stranger among his people.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: Whether you like it or not, you're forced to come to the realisation that death is out there. But I don't fear death, I'm a fatalist. I believe when it's your time, that's it. It's the hand you're dealt.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: We as Americans believe it's OK to kill people. We believe it's OK to invade a country that had nothing to do with 9/11. We think it's OK to invade a country where we think Osama Bin Laden is and he's in the other country. So we just go in and we just kill. And we have the death penalty we sanction it.
author: Michael Moore

quote: If nothing else, there's comfort in recognising that no matter how much we fail and sin, death will limit our suffering.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: There's something about death that is comforting. The thought that you could die tomorrow frees you to appreciate your life now.
author: Angelina Jolie

quote: In cold weather states like Vermont, where the weather can get to 20 below zero, home heating assistance is critically important. In fact, it is a life and death issue.
author: Bernie Sanders

quote: 'Biutiful' is not about death. It's about life. It's a hymn to life.
author: Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu

quote: Death is frightening, and so is Eternal Life.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: I was not encouraged to follow the career of a writer because my parents thought that I was going to starve to death. They thought nobody can make a living from being a writer in Brazil. They were not wrong.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: The more you live in the present moment, the more the fear of death disappears.
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: To himself everyone is immortal; he may know that he is going to die, but he can never know that he is dead.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: I hate death it takes people away from you. You're left feeling rudderless.
author: John Lydon

quote: This country is being managed to death, being public related to death.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: I don't think I would want the responsibility for enforcing the death penalties. There's always the inevitable question of whether someone you gave the order to execute might truly have been innocent.
author: Jesse Ventura

quote: Previous generations understood about death, and undoubtedly would have seen a reasonable amount of death. Once you get into the Victorian era, you might well have seen the funerals of many of your siblings before you were very old.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Nothing can happen more beautiful than death.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I'm not afraid of death, but I resent it. I think it's unfair and irritating.
author: Viggo Mortensen

quote: 'Tis very certain the desire of life prolongs it.
author: Lord Byron

quote: In shuttering Yucca Mountain, Obama makes it extremely likely that nuclear power in the United States will continue its long, slow, and extremely welcome death.
author: Timothy Noah

quote: When death, the great reconciler, has come, it is never our tenderness that we repent of, but our severity.
author: George Eliot

quote: When death comes it is never our tenderness that we repent from, but our severity.
author: George Eliot

quote: In every parting there is an image of death.
author: George Eliot

quote: Thanks to presidential immunity and executive control of the Justice Department, there are no consequences to executive branch lawbreaking. And when it comes to presidential lawbreaking, the sitting president could literally strangle someone to death on national television and meet with no consequences.
author: Ben Shapiro

quote: No one else can take risks for us, or face our losses on our behalf, or give us self-esteem. No one can spare us from life's slings and arrows, and when death comes, we meet it alone.
author: Martha Beck

quote: The Caribbean is such an apocalyptic place, whether it's the decimation of the indigenous populations by the Europeans, whether it's the importation of slaves and their subsequent being worked to death by the millions in many ways, whether it's the immigrant processes which began for many people, new worlds ending their old ones.
author: Junot Diaz

quote: Perhaps we don't need these religious concoctions to pillow the fear of death. Just the fact that there is an unknown, and something greater, can bring a feeling of peace. That's enough for me.
author: Brad Pitt

quote: 'Thor' has got several big battles in it, a reckless, headstrong young hero who has to confront his past and deal with a complicated relationship with his father, it has lots of savage Europeans hacking each other to death at various points, and all of this sounded very much like 'Henry V.'
author: Kenneth Branagh

quote: Death, they say, acquits us of all obligations.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: The death of Christ proclaimed the justice and perpetuity of his Father's law in punishing the transgressor, in that he consented to suffer the penalty of the law himself, in order to save fallen man from its curse.
author: Ellen G. White

quote: God gave our first parents the food He designed that the race should eat. It was contrary to His plan to have the life of any creature taken. There was to be no death in Eden. The fruit of the trees in the garden was the food man's wants required.
author: Ellen G. White

quote: People think celebrities don't have to worry about human things like sickness and death and rent. It's like you've traveled to this Land of Celebrity, this other country.
author: David Duchovny

quote: Die, v.: To stop sinning suddenly.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Death is softer by far than tyranny.
author: Aeschylus

quote: It is not death or pain that is to be dreaded, but the fear of pain or death.
author: Epictetus

quote: I am not afraid of death, I just don't want to be there when it happens.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Life inspires more dread than death - it is life which is the great unknown.
author: Emile M. Cioran

quote: The medication I had to take was a form of chemotherapy. You feel like death every day. No appetite. No energy. But the treatment worked. It cured my liver 80 per cent but compromised my kidneys.
author: Natalie Cole

quote: I think the minute you mention death, people run for the hills - unless it's heavy metal. People do not like death.
author: Rufus Wainwright

quote: People always say that pregnant women have a glow. And I say it's because you're sweating to death.
author: Jessica Simpson

quote: Writing my novel 'The Narrow Road to the Deep North,' I came to conclude that great crimes like the Death Railway did not begin with the first beating or murder on that grim line of horror in 1943.
author: Richard Flanagan

quote: Chronic Lyme causes arthritis, heart problems, stroke - even death.
author: Daryl Hall

quote: Are there moments when I see unrequited crushes or ex-boyfriends slow dancing with their dates and kind of want to stab myself in the spleen with a salad fork? Yeah, sure.
author: Sloane Crosley

quote: Tradition demands that we not speak poorly of the dead.
author: Daniel Barenboim

quote: In a story, you have to have a theme and an angle, you have to have a beginning, middle and an end. You have to have a defining moment and kick it to death. You gotta be able to recognize that, by the way. It probably takes experience.
author: Dan Jenkins

quote: The poorer people and criminals of Mexico who are not very religious but not quite atheists, either, worship Saint Death.
author: Karl Pilkington

quote: She looks like a warrior. I mean, Bellatrix does mean warrior. And she's also a bit of a fatale. She's the right hand of Voldemort, and the only woman death eater.
author: Helena Bonham Carter

quote: There was a docudrama that was made, called 'The Death Of A Princess,' which was about a true story in Saudi Arabia. It was about a public execution for adultery. And when the movie was aired on British television, the Saudi government threatened to cut off oil exports and to cut off diplomatic relations.
author: Evan Osnos

quote: I try to write lyrics so that they won't age, which sort of leaves you with the big subjects like death and love and sex and violence.
author: Florence Welch

quote: To have died once is enough.
author: Virgil

quote: In all the difficult decisions that I made through the course of running Loudcloud and Opsware, I never once felt brave. In fact, I often felt scared to death. I never lost those feelings, but after much practice, I learned to ignore them. That learning process might also be called the courage development process.
author: Ben Horowitz

quote: For me, habit is just a synonym for death.
author: Juliette Binoche

quote: One of the top causes of startup death - right after cofounder problems - is building something no one wants.
author: Kathryn Minshew

quote: The cycle of life is death, decomposition and regeneration, and a person who wants to stop killing animals is actually anti-life because it's only in death that life can be regenerated.
author: Joel Salatin

quote: I don't worry. I'm more stoical. Of course I have insecurities. I fear getting older. I fear death and illness. I'm not prone to depression, but I get depressed because everybody gets depressed. Suddenly I'm away from my family or doing a job I'm not enjoying.
author: David Thewlis

quote: My life comes down to three moments: the death of my father, meeting my husband, and the birth of my daughter. Everything I did previous to that just doesn't seem to add up to very much.
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

quote: A friend who dies, it's something of you who dies.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: I think what we're going to hear is that we didn't meet the basic, minimum standards required for a facility such as the one we had in Benghazi. And the request for more security personnel went unheeded, unanswered, and consequently, you know, you have the death of four Americans.
author: Jason Chaffetz

quote: I am not a proponent of the death penalty, but I will enforce the law as this Congress gives it to us.
author: Eric Holder

quote: I am deeply saddened by the death of my dear friend, Dudley Moore.
author: Liza Minnelli

quote: Everyone sees something different in 'Endgame': a biblical apocalypse, a portrait of painful co-dependency, a confession of guilt and dignity in the face of death, a night of baffling hopelessness, a meaningless babble. Each interpretation reveals an absurd truth - not about the play, but about the person watching it.
author: Simon McBurney

quote: I've had various people close to me die, and I don't necessarily find the idea of death purely depressing.
author: Simon McBurney

quote: I don't believe in life after death. But I do believe in some grinding destiny that watches over us on earth. If I didn't, the safety valve would give and the boiler would explode.
author: Hedy Lamarr

quote: I don't fear death because I don't fear anything I don't understand. When I start to think about it, I order a massage and it goes away.
author: Hedy Lamarr

quote: It is difficult to accept death in this society because it is unfamiliar. In spite of the fact that it happens all the time, we never see it.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: For years, I have been stalked by a bad reputation. Actually, I have been pursued by people who have regarded me as the 'Death and Dying' Lady. They believe that having spent more than three decades in research into death and life after death qualifies me as an expert on the subject. I think they miss the point.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: There are people who never experience that, who remain closed until death, from fear of change.
author: Isabelle Adjani

quote: I'm scared to death of being poor. It's like a fat girl who loses 500 pounds but is always fat inside. I grew up poor and will always feel poor inside. It's my pet paranoia.
author: Cher

quote: Since the day of my birth, my death began its walk. It is walking toward me, without hurrying.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: When I was a child, I used to paint intently. The older I become, and the closer death approaches, the brighter my life gets day by day.
author: Yayoi Kusama

quote: We die only once, and for such a long time.
author: Moliere

quote: Someone who is about to die does not mourn the dead.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: No one wants to live in a wheelchair unable to talk, only winking once for yes and twice for no. It's perfectly reasonable that there will come a point where the balance of judgment of life over death swings the other way.
author: Tony Judt

quote: The body dies, but the spirit that transcends it cannot be touched by death.
author: Ramana Maharshi

quote: Death is the easiest of all things after it, and the hardest of all things before it.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: My mother was the sweetest lady who ever lived on this planet, but if you tried to tell her that Jesus wasn't a Christian, she would stomp you to death.
author: Dick Gregory

quote: Instead of thinking that's a nice tune, you start thinking is it the right pace, is it the right tempo? That is the death nell for artists.
author: Alison Moyet

quote: All societies on the verge of death are masculine. A society can survive with only one man no society will survive a shortage of women.
author: Germaine Greer

quote: When you think about it, the end of the world is a little bit like death: We all know it's going to come eventually, and as we get older, we feel we see the signs more and more distinctly.
author: John Hodgman

quote: People are scared to death of dying. I am the opposite.
author: Taylor Caldwell

quote: When I was in high school, I listened to a lot of death metal bands.
author: Amy Lee

quote: The fertility cycle is a cycle entirely of living creatures passing again and again through birth, growth, maturity, death, and decay.
author: Wendell Berry

quote: The experiences associated with death were seen as visits to important dimensions of reality that deserved to be experienced, studied, and carefully mapped.
author: Stanislav Grof

quote: The death penalty is becoming a way of life in this country.
author: Dennis Miller

quote: All architects want to live beyond their deaths.
author: Philip Johnson

quote: When I arrived in France aged 20, I marched against the death penalty, which was an unpopular thing to protest against at the time.
author: Jane Birkin

quote: I think the amazing thing about gospel music is that not only does it lift up the death and resurrection of our Lord, which is consistent with the Gospel, but it is uniquely communicated depending upon the generation.
author: T. D. Jakes

quote: Do not fear death so much but rather the inadequate life.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: John Candy knew he was going to die. He told me on his 40th birthday. He said, well, Maureen, I'm on borrowed time.
author: Maureen O'Hara

quote: Not death but disease is the real enemy; disease, the malign force that requires confrontation. Death is the surcease that comes when the exhausting battle has been lost.
author: Sherwin B. Nuland

quote: My original inspiration was my mom: a few years after the death of my dad, she started dating one my teachers!
author: Meg Cabot

quote: Plenty of people detested Michael Jackson before his death wiped away the world's collective memory. Timberlake was originally dismissed as just another boy-bander. Legions have joined in a 'Hate Anne Hathaway' movement. Elvis, the Rolling Stones, Kristen Bell, even Mozart had haters.
author: Kurt Eichenwald

quote: I can choose to accelerate my disease to an alcoholic death or incurable insanity, or I can choose to live within my thoroughly human condition.
author: Mercedes McCambridge

quote: I tell myself that God gave my children many gifts - spirit, beauty, intelligence, the capacity to make friends and to inspire respect. There was only one gift he held back - length of life.
author: Rose Kennedy

quote: Death is always around the corner, but often our society gives it inordinate help.
author: Carter Burwell

quote: Disasters such as earthquakes, tsunamis, volcanoes, floods, oil spills and radioactive fallout cause massive death of people, pigs, bats and birds. These disasters also impact the immune health of survivors. All harbor viruses.
author: Paul Stamets

quote: It is possible to provide security against other ills, but as far as death is concerned, we men live in a city without walls.
author: Epicurus

quote: Israel should not feel satisfaction at my son's death, for he died on the battlefield, facing the conquerors as he wished, with a gun in his hand.
author: Hassan Nasrallah

quote: Even one heatstroke death is one too many because every death caused by leaving a child unattended in a hot car is 100 percent avoidable.
author: Anthony Foxx

quote: If you don't have any fight in you, you might as well be dead.
author: Scott Caan

quote: I think, in real life, when we're facing death - that is, when we come out on the other side of it, whether it's death of a friend or a family member - you come out on the other side of the mourning cherishing your life that much more.
author: Tony DiTerlizzi

quote: I hope to die in the saddle seat.
author: Albert Ellis

quote: Those who welcome death have only tried it from the ears up.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: But for me, it is when a student has died. I find the death of a young person the most difficult and painful of times. To explain it to other young people, to see a bright future snuffed out, is just awful. I am haunted by those deaths.
author: Donna Shalala

quote: I shall not die of a cold. I shall die of having lived.
author: Willa Cather

quote: I was court-martialled in my absence, and sentenced to death in my absence, so I said they could shoot me in my absence.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: Once a disease has entered the body, all parts which are healthy must fight it: not one alone, but all. Because a disease might mean their common death. Nature knows this; and Nature attacks the disease with whatever help she can muster.
author: Paracelsus

quote: When you're dead, you're dead. That's it.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Dickinson is my hero because she was a joker, because she would never explain, because as a poet she confronted pain, dread and death, and because she was capable of speaking of those matters with both levity and seriousness. She's my hero because she was a metaphysical adventurer.
author: Helen Oyeyemi

quote: I was in a rock band; I was my own folk singer; I was in a death metal band for a very short time; I was in a cover band, a jazz band, a blues band. I was in a gospel choir.
author: Kiesza

quote: For tis not in mere death that men die most.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: The Greeks said grandly in their tragic phrase, 'Let no one be called happy till his death;' to which I would add, 'Let no one, till his death, be called unhappy.'
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: I like death. I'm a big fan of it.
author: Guy Ritchie

quote: The death of what's dead is the birth of what's living.
author: Arlo Guthrie

quote: Only comedians can talk about death, life, God and Virgin Mary. If I was a tragic actor, I couldn't allow myself. But with this accent I can do it. I can talk with death in person because I am a clown. Yes. And I am proud to be a clown - very much.
author: Roberto Benigni

quote: We were aware of the fact that death walks hand in hand with struggle.
author: Stokely Carmichael

quote: I spend a lot of time with Buddhists. I'm not a Buddhist, but their relationship with death interests me.
author: Joan Baez

quote: Cardiovascular diseases are the leading cause of death in women.
author: Gro Harlem Brundtland

quote: Man dies of cold, not of darkness.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: With attention deficit democracy, I am trying to wake up people to how the combination of mass ignorance, fear mongering by the government, and lying politicians is putting our entire system of government to a death spiral.
author: James Bovard

quote: We ourselves can die with comfort and even with joy if we know that death is but a passport to blessedness, that this intellect, freed from all material chains, shall rise and shine.
author: Matthew Simpson

quote: He who is completely sanctified, or cleansed from all sin, and dies in this state, is fit for glory.
author: Adam Clarke

quote: I can't have white roses. They symbolize death.
author: Nina Arianda

quote: I chose not to put a wig on. The reason why I chose to come out with the cancer thing is because there's somebody out there who can see that all sickness isn't unto death. That it's something you can't change at that point in time, so you just got to go with it. Don't be ashamed. Don't be ashamed of looking at yourself.
author: Sharon Jones

quote: I got well by talking. Death could not get a word in edgewise, grew discouraged, and traveled on.
author: Louise Erdrich

quote: You know, your first album is about really amazing things. Your first album is always about coming of age, first love, first loss, usually you suffer a first loss of someone that you love to death, even, you know, really big life lessons, things you learn from your parents' divorce or from the travels that you took.
author: Brandi Carlile

quote: None of us, in our culture of comfort, know how to prepare ourselves for dying, but that's what we should do every day. Every single day, we die a thousand deaths.
author: Joni Eareckson Tada

quote: If you die in an elevator, be sure to push the Up button.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: Some people are so afraid to die that they never begin to live.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: The death industry markets caskets and embalming under the rubric of helping bodies look 'natural,' but our current death customs are as natural as training majestic creatures like bears and elephants to dance in cute little outfits, or erecting replicas of the Eiffel Tower and Venetian canals in the middle of the harsh American desert.
author: Caitlin Doughty

quote: Death is better than slavery.
author: Harriet Ann Jacobs

quote: The poet does not fear death, not because he believes in the fantasy of heroes, but because death constantly visits his thoughts and is thus an image of a serene dialogue.
author: Salvatore Quasimodo

quote: We're also the only country that has the Death Penalty. That's something to boast about, isn't it?
author: Tony Randall

quote: Johnny Ringo to me was just the best antagonist that I've ever played, because I played him as a guy who has a death wish and had done everything that he wanted in life. As far as he was concerned, a gun fight was about as exciting as it was going to get.
author: Michael Biehn

quote: There must be a punitive expedition against the Jews in Russia, a punitive expedition which will expect: death sentence and execution. Then the world will see the end of the Jews is also the end of Bolshevism.
author: Julius Streicher

quote: To date or not to date that is the question. It's almost as important as Shakespeare's to be or not to be which deals with death.
author: Al Goldstein

quote: Art has two constant, two unending concerns: It always meditates on death and thus always creates life. All great, genuine art resembles and continues the Revelation of St John.
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: Death is not more certainly a separation of our souls from our bodies than the Christian life is a separation of our souls from worldly tempers, vain indulgences, and unnecessary cares.
author: William Law

quote: But the issue is not only life and death but our existence before God and our being judged by him. All of us were sinners before him and worthy of condemnation.
author: Hans Urs von Balthasar

quote: Death is the beginning of something.
author: Edith Piaf

quote: Sometimes the early bird gets the worm, but sometimes the early bird gets frozen to death.
author: Myron Scholes

quote: The Death of Advertising? I think that's in the book of Revelation. It's the day when people everywhere become satisfied with their weight, their hair, their skin, their wardrobe, and their aroma.
author: Jef I. Richards

quote: When we have done our best, we can, as a united people, take whatever may befall with calm courage and confidence that this old nation will survive and if death should come to many of us, death is not the end.
author: Eamon de Valera

quote: Hell, madam, is to love no longer.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: All our knowledge merely helps us to die a more painful death than animals that know nothing.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: If you make every game a life and death proposition, you're going to have problems. For one thing, you'll be dead a lot.
author: Dean Smith

quote: Father's Day was great, but all the family gatherings brought up my mother's death. Maybe it's me, because I am a wimp. We would get together, but there was someone missing!
author: Doug Davidson

quote: We cannot banish dangers, but we can banish fears. We must not demean life by standing in awe of death.
author: David Sarnoff

quote: A detective sees death in all the various forms at least five times a week.
author: Evan Hunter

quote: I have been here before as a spirit - this is just my physical body, it is just an overcoat. And at death, you will take the overcoat off.
author: Glenn Hoddle

quote: Becoming a parent gives you access to a whole world of feeling. It gives you a much stronger sense of life and death: becoming a father made me realise my own mortality.
author: Laurence Fox

quote: I almost always start with setting! I have to know the world before I know how to populate it. I have a tendency to play with doors - between life and death, human and monster, mundane and magic - and with 'ADSOM,' I knew I wanted to play with the physical doors between worlds.
author: V. E. Schwab

quote: His death was the first time that Ed Wynn ever made anyone sad.
author: Red Skelton

quote: I don't believe in death.
author: Bob Weir

quote: Lovers of air travel find it exhilarating to hang poised between the illusion of immortality and the fact of death.
author: Alexander Chase

quote: Death by starvation is slow.
author: Mary Hunter Austin

quote: Call no man happy before he dies, he is at best but fortunate.
author: Solon

quote: Death's in the good-bye.
author: Anne Sexton

quote: Death borders upon our birth, and our cradle stands in the grave.
author: Joseph Hall

quote: Death is the tyrant of the imagination.
author: Bryan Procter

quote: Is there a point at which we hit a tipping point and all of this economic, cultural and moral trouble sends us into a death spiral we can't get out of?
author: Joel C. Rosenberg

quote: She goes through the vale of death alone, each time a babe is born. As it is the right neither of man nor the state to coerce her into this ordeal, so it is her right to decide whether she will endure it.
author: Margaret Sanger

quote: I am not a 'defender' of the September 11 attacks, but simply pointing out that if U.S. foreign policy results in massive death and destruction abroad, we cannot feign innocence when some of that destruction is returned.
author: Ward Churchill

quote: From birth to death, anyone can fish. I just think it's fantastic to see old people going fishing with young people and teaching them things. I'm very, very critical.
author: Rex Hunt

quote: The timing of death, like the ending of a story, gives a changed meaning to what preceded it.
author: Mary Catherine Bateson

quote: Birth and death are the most singular events we experience - and the contemplation of death, as of birth, should be a thing of beauty, not ignobility.
author: Jacob K. Javits

quote: Soldiers are citizens of death's grey land, drawing no dividend from time's tomorrows.
author: Siegfried Sassoon

quote: If fame is to come only after death, I am in no hurry for it.
author: Marcus Valerius Martial

quote: If you don't have imagination, you stop being human; animals don't have imagination; Alzheimer's is the death of imagination.
author: Devdutt Pattanaik

quote: Well the themes for me were and remain sex and love and grief and death - the things that make us and undo us, create and destroy, how we breed and disappear and the emotional context that surrounds these events.
author: Thomas Lynch

quote: Fling but a stone, the giant dies.
author: Matthew Green

quote: You don't send a man to his death because you want a hero.
author: Paddy Chayefsky

quote: The prime minister found something hopeful in the man's eyes and manner. The 30 or so people who run this world analyze one another that way and then make decisions of life and death for us. Scary, but true.
author: Hugh Sidey

quote: I guess I don't believe that death is the end.
author: Pam Dawber

quote: It was from an old friend who thought he was dying. Anyway, he said, 'Life and death issues don't come along that often, thank God, so don't treat everything like it's life or death. Go easier.'
author: Thomas Arnold

quote: How many wives have been forced by the death of well-intentioned but too protective husbands to face reality late in life, bewildered and frightened because they were strangers to it!
author: Hortense Odlum

quote: Death calls ye to the crowd of common men.
author: James Shirley

quote: I can't let my mother's death have been in vain. Democracy is the best revenge, and we will have it.
author: Bilawal Bhutto Zardari

quote: You think, eventually, that nothing can disturb you and that your nerves are impregnable. Yet, looking down at that familiar face, I realized that death is something to which we never become calloused.
author: Eliot Ness

quote: I am not afraid of death, but would not want to die in some obscure or pointless way.
author: Isabelle Eberhardt

quote: Nothing that is really good and God-like dies.
author: Ernst Moritz Arndt

quote: It is only in the light of the inescapable fact of death that a person can adequately engage and enter upon the mysterious fact of life.
author: John Hines

quote: He who doesn't fear death dies only once.
author: Giovanni Falcone

quote: Death is the last enemy: once we've got past that I think everything will be alright.
author: Alice Thomas Ellis

quote: I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin, but by the content of their character.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Racism is still with us. But it is up to us to prepare our children for what they have to meet, and, hopefully, we shall overcome.
author: Rosa Parks

quote: Here are the values that I stand for: honesty, equality, kindness, compassion, treating people the way you want to be treated and helping those in need. To me, those are traditional values.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: If we cannot now end our differences, at least we can help make the world safe for diversity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The worst form of inequality is to try to make unequal things equal.
author: Aristotle

quote: I speak not for myself but for those without voice... those who have fought for their rights... their right to live in peace, their right to be treated with dignity, their right to equality of opportunity, their right to be educated.
author: Malala Yousafzai

quote: No struggle can ever succeed without women participating side by side with men.
author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

quote: The earth is the mother of all people, and all people should have equal rights upon it.
author: Chief Joseph

quote: If you want to see the true measure of a man, watch how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.
author: J. K. Rowling
category: Man, Measure Of A Man, Want

quote: True equality means holding everyone accountable in the same way, regardless of race, gender, faith, ethnicity - or political ideology.
author: Monica Crowley

quote: Education promotes equality and lifts people out of poverty. It teaches children how to become good citizens. Education is not just for a privileged few, it is for everyone. It is a fundamental human right.
